newsitem.title: USA: Halstead sees purchase boosting revenues.
newsitem.headline: Halstead sees purchase boosting revenues.

text.p: Halstead Energy Corp said Thursday it has acquired certain assets of Dino Oil Inc, adding this is expected to increase annual revenues by nearly 50 percent.
Halstead said it acquired Dino, a gasoline distributor based in New York City's Bronx borough, for an undisclosed amount of cash and Halstead common stock.

The acquisition is expected to generate sales of an additional nine million gallons of gasoline in the fiscal year ending August 31, 1997, the company said. This would increase the company's fiscal 1997 revenues (at current price levels), to about $23 million, compared with an expected $15 million in revenues in fiscal 1996.
